alert.note: Alert for Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 25 at 3:11PM MDT until June 26 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, AND UPPER RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEY DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WIND AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH TUESDAY AFTERNOONS AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WIND AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Strengthening southwest flow across northwestern New Mexico in advance of a slow moving Pacific low will combine with an extremely dry and unstable atmosphere to produce critical fire weather conditions both Monday and Tuesday. The strongest winds are expected Tuesday, when isolated, gusty, and dry thunderstorms are also forecast with areas of extreme fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Monday. * AREA AND TIMING...Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley Monday afternoon and early evening. Isolated dry thunderstorms are also forecast. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
